heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 13 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.3°C).

Today’s average cloud levels is 295.9m higher than yesterday, 251.5m higher than the past week, 41.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1043m minimum and 1366m maximum, with an average of 1530.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1279.4m and 1572.7m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
